intro: Psychotria chrysophylla, commonly known as the golden-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow foliage, which contrasts with its small, white or greenish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
